body:
`conda list` give the following:


I created Python environment using conda, but install Jupyter in it using `pip install jupyter`.

Did you put your ipython config file in a profile folder? Run ipython
profile create to get the default folder.

@takluyver, I changed the placement of IPython and Jupyter notebook config folders. I use special script for this:

```
import os
import subprocess

APP_ROOT = os.getcwd() # folder where .bat file starts
DIST = os.path.join(APP_ROOT, 'dist')
JUPYTER_ROOT = os.path.join(DIST, '.jupyter')
IPYTHON_ROOT = os.path.join(DIST, '.ipython')

os.environ["JUPYTER_CONFIG_DIR"] = JUPYTER_ROOT
os.environ["JUPYTER_DATA_DIR"] = os.path.join(JUPYTER_ROOT, "data")
os.environ["JUPYTER_RUNTIME_DIR"] = os.path.join(JUPYTER_ROOT, "data", "runtime")

os.environ["IPYTHONDIR"] = IPYTHON_ROOT

os.environ["MPLCONFIGDIR"] = os.path.join(DIST, ".matplotlib")

os.environ["FFMPEG_EXE"] = os.path.join(DIST, "opt_apps", "ffmpeg", "bin")
# We need add ffmpeg.exe path to PATH, because matplotlib will search ffmpeg there
os.environ["PATH"] += (";" + os.environ["FFMPEG_EXE"])

# Start Jupyter Notebook
app_path = os.path.join(DIST, "pyenv3-win64", "Scripts", "jupyter-notebook.exe")
projects_path = "projects"
subprocess.Popen("{} --notebook-dir='{}'".format(app_path, projects_path), shell=True)
```

But your advice was helpful for me. I generate new ipython config file using `ipython profile create` and found this in profile folder (but I placed this file in .ipython). I didn't found `c.InlineBackend.rc` in generated ipython_config.py and just added it myself. After that all works.

So I just placed the copy of my ipython_config.py in wrong place. Sorry for inconvenience. Thanks!
Thank you for your report. I'm glad you were able to resolve this @AndreWin and kudos to @takluyver for the assist, 🍰 for everyone! Closing.
